summary: Hell yes, I’m still buzzing about the possibilities that The Mandalorian can deliver but when I read this.... .....*nodding* I...
body:
Hell yes, I’m still buzzing about the possibilities that The Mandalorian can deliver but when I read this….

…..*nodding*
I definitely peed a little. 

*87th fangirl scream*

Cassian’s story. The burgeoning rebellion against the Empire. Fulcrum…

*88th fangirl scream*

body:
December writing ideas:

  • Kinda want to do like an advent calendar sort of thing - a winter/Christmas themed drabble every day in December. (Maybe even setting up a side blog so other people could submit things if they want?)
  • But if @landolove is still planning on doing something, I’d take part in that instead. (I think there was some discussion about Lando prompts in December but I can’t find the post.)
  • I definitely wanna do winter/Christmas themed SW fics so if anyone has any links to fests/prompt weeks etc, send them my way!

summary: So, I'm perpetually late to the party and finally watched The Last Jedi. There was a lot going on, but here's my hot take: The...
body:
So, I’m perpetually late to the party and finally watched The Last Jedi. There was a lot going on, but here’s my hot take: The movie could be interpreted as an extended metaphor for the Star Wars series itself.

You can’t always get what you think you deserve. If you’re blinded by nostalgia or entitlement, the only thing that’s going to happen is that you’ll end up walking down the same only tired steps and going through the same old motions and making the same old mistakes over and over again. Sometimes if you want to move forward, you have to kill and bury your past, even if it’s scary and even if it’s going to make a lot of people who don’t understand what you’re doing angry with you. Leaving the past behind and facing the unknown is the only way to get to somewhere truly new and exciting.

That’s my two cents, anyway.

summary: My 5 yo old son is playing with Darth Vader and Captain America action figures. He has them facing each other and speaks for...
body: My 5 yo old son is playing with Darth Vader and Captain America action figures. He has them facing each other and speaks for them. One is telling the other a story, that I am half listening to. I check back in just in time to hear him say, “He took his mask off and he was not excellent like his grandpa, his grandpa walked and walked the desert but he found nothing”. First off I want to know what his interpretation of Star Wars is. Second of all, Kylo is Excellent!!! Lol (I feel attacked)

blog.name: themandalorianwolf

blog.description: Lone Wanderer | House Stark | Mandalorian | Filmmaker | Writer | Gryffindor Dropout | Wakanda Resident | African Brazilian | Finn, Ahsoka, and Luke deserve better.

summary: I don't understand people who want/think Rey is a nobody. "I love the freshness and themes of a powerful hero coming from...
body:
I don’t understand people who want/think Rey is a nobody. “I love the freshness and themes of a powerful hero coming from nowhere.”

So beyond the fact that Rey’s origins are very similar to Anakin’s and Luke’s, and that her story hits the same beats as Luke, these people forget that there already is a powerful hero from nowhere who actually had an original origins.

Finn was a Stormtrooper, he literally rose up from not even having a name to being one the face of the Resistance. Furthermore, Finn has been the hero from nothing since TFA.

Oh, and I see the same argument for both. “Rey being a Skywalker ruins her character,” and “Finn being Force Sensitive ruins his character.”

It’s just a bloody amazing thing that only when the protagonists are a woman and a black man, does something that would be a natural next step in their story seem to be a deal breaker for the character.

The best people that call the Skywalkers “Noble” do realize that in universe no one thinks that? The Skywalkers are farmers, slaves, 2 fall war monger a Jedi, and and a Jedi turned hermit.

And since when did the force become something that had to fit a special criteria? Broom Boy and Holdo have the bloody force. Animals have the force. Everyone has the force.

“Oh, I just love the theme of the sequel trilogy having a protagonist that isn’t related to anyone.”

Cool, we got Finn for that.

“Oh, but I like a character to be a badass normal.”

Dope, we have Poe Dameron and Rose Tico for that.

“But Luke can just adopt Rey and it’s just like he had a kid.”

So…you want Luke to adopt Rey, but not have her be his biological daughter? You want to over complicate things…why?

IMO I can understand having issues with the way certain fans believe, but narratively I’ll never understand people who take issue with Finn being force sensitive or Rey being a Skywalker.

blog.name: glenhannah
blog.title: RockingDoggy Retro
blog.description: Retro. Vintage. Nostalgia. Paraphernalia. Ephemera. Pop culture. Exploring the past. Original photos, scans, reviews, writings. Blogging from Australia, so a lot of the content will be from downunder.

title: Remembering Star Wars & Empire 1977 - 1981
body:
Great bunch of clippings and articles here from old Australian publications

First up -  a couple of pin ups. This famous Droid pose from the film from a 1977 (Australian) People magazine. Pity about that barcode.

Below: Mark Hamill gets a solo pinup in (Australian) TV Times in 1978

1979 - Carrie Fisher interview. Headline makes you think she’s making some revelation about depression or something but it’s just her “gloomy” apartment.

1980 - Another Carrie interview as everyone is anticipating “Star Wars 2″

1980 - (Australian) People magazine previews Empire Strikes Back. Article mentions that it’s part of a 9 part series.

1980 - Dave Prowse profile from TV Week. Yep we get it. He’s a big guy.

1981 - Snippet from an old video guide bemoaning that Star Wars was still unavailable on video (really?)

I do recall the Making of Star Wars VHS video.That was everywhere in the early years of Home VHS.

Bonus pic: Not the real R2D2.I snapped this picture of a couple of Star Wars characters at a Con in 2011. Recently unearthed the picture from on an old camera of mine.

blog.name: mandowords
blog.title: Miit'alor
blog.description: I am a descriptivist linguist for the Mando'a language. I show what it can do, not what it MUST do. This is a place for discussion about Mando'a, and Mandalorian society and culture. Feel free to use the head cannons from this blog (or reblogged from others) in your RP or writing. All words and descriptions are taken from the mandoa.org Mandalorian Dictionary. Want to support this blog? Buy me a Kofi? OR buy some Mando'a themed items? Visit our Discord? Blog icon by Rina

blog.name: geekynerfherder
blog.title: Geeky Nerfherder
blog.description: UK based. Connoisseur of pop culture. Enthusiast of good things. Lover of Sci-fi & Fantasy. Devotee of contemporary, fantastical, comic & vintage art. Posting all that and more that grabs my interest.

summary: I've previously showcased a few of my favourite pop culture and vintage pulp artists, and each weekend I showcase art from more...
caption:
I’ve previously showcased a few of my favourite pop culture and vintage pulp artists, and each weekend I showcase art from more of my favourite artists.

The art of Jeff Boyes.

blog.description:
An AO3 Feed for the Star Wars - All Media Types tag.

Icon from the Star Wars App.

title: Seven Days of Interrogation
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2qBFUzS

by kelseycurtis

This fic contains NON CON, DO NOT READ IF TRIGGERED!

Cora has been captured by The First Order, Kylo and Hux use very interesting torture methods to get the information they need.

This fic is just pure porn

Words: 1867, Chapters: 1/7, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Star Wars - All Media Types, Star Wars Sequel Trilogy
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence, Rape/Non-Con
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Kylo Ren, Armitage Hux, Original Female Character(s)
  • Relationships: Kylo Ren/Original Female Character(s), Armitage Hux/Original Female Character(s)
  • Additional Tags: Plot What Plot/Porn Without Plot, Porn, Rape/Non-con Elements, Torture, Explicit Sexual Content, Oral Sex, Sex, Rough Sex, Vaginal Sex, Sex Toys, Vaginal Fingering, Masturbation, Slut Shaming, Kylo Ren is Not Nice, Hux is Not Nice, Vibrators, Inappropriate Use of the Force, Bondage, Choking, Force Choking, Leather Kink, Glove Kink, Interrogation


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2qBFUzS
